usart0_put_pgm_string.c File Reference

#include "usart.h"

Functions

void usart0_put_pgm_string (const char *FlashString)

Function Documentation

void usart0_put_pgm_string ( const char *   ) 

Loads a string from program memory into the transmit buffer.

Parameters:
pointer to a constant character string

Example: 

        // Define string outside any function
        const char pgm_str1[] PROGMEM =  "This is a program memory string defined outside any function.\r";
        ...
        // Put the program memory string into the transmit buffer
        usart0_put_pgm_string(pgm_str1);
        // Transmit it
        usart0_send();

        // Use with a string intialized in the function
        usart0_put_pgm_string(PSTR("This is a program memory string using PSTR within a function.\r"));
        usart0_send();

The 'for' logic terminates if the byte is '' or if i = 60. '' is 'null' and terminates C strings The 80 prevents too much overrun if we get a bad pointer and it limits the string size
